response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agency must determine whether records are subject to access and permit inspection and copying within reasonable amount of time, not to exceed 3 business days
response_requirements.extension_notes: No statutory extension provision; 3 business days is maximum

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: First quarter hour (15 minutes) free; thereafter may charge prorated hourly salary of lowest-paid qualified employee for research, retrieval, redaction, and administrative costs
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Up to $0.10 per page for copies 8.5 x 14 inches or smaller; actual cost for larger copies

exemptions.description: Records specifically required by federal statute or regulation or by state statute to be kept confidential
Medical or veterinary records and similar files, the disclosure of which would be an invasion of personal privacy
Records compiled for law enforcement or prosecution purposes; specific investigative files; pending investigations
Social security numbers, credit card info, bank account info, passwords, financial data, unlisted phone numbers, personal email, birth dates
Passwords, keys, alarm codes, entry codes for secured areas
Valuable trade secrets or commercially valuable information of any private person, corporation, or other entity
Records developed for litigation under attorney-client privilege; communications between agency and private attorney
Personnel records and personal information of employees in state personnel records
Preliminary drafts and notes; intragovernmental communications
Student records which are confidential under federal law (FERPA)

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No formal administrative appeal process; can request Attorney General to bring action or file civil action directly in superior court for declaratory or injunctive relief
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court shall assess reasonable attorney fees and litigation costs if agency acted without substantial justification, unless special circumstances exist

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Any person, firm, corporation, or other entity may request records; no requirement to state purpose or prove standing
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Request may be made orally or in writing; if both oral and written request made for same records, written request controls
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must identify records sought with reasonable specificity

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Individual in charge of records must not refuse inspection to any citizen; individual or agency with custody determines access
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must produce electronic copies or printouts of electronic records using programs agency maintains; cannot create new records or compile, cross-reference, or reorganize existing records
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Broadly construed to allow inspection; exceptions interpreted narrowly

oversight_body.name: Georgia Attorney General
oversight_body.role: May bring civil or criminal actions to enforce the Open Records Act upon request; provides advisory opinions

primary_sources: Official Code of Georgia Annotated Sections 50-18-70 through 50-18-78
Georgia Open Records Act statutory text
Georgia Attorney General Open Government guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Georgia statute. Response timeline: 3 business days maximum (no extension allowed). First 15 minutes of search/retrieval free, then may charge prorated hourly salary of lowest-paid qualified employee. Copy fees up to $0.10 per page. No formal administrative appeal process - goes directly to superior court. Attorney fees available if agency acts without substantial justification. Strong policy favoring open government with narrow construction of exemptions. 50+ specific statutory exemptions covering medical records, law enforcement investigations, personal information, trade secrets, personnel records, deliberative process.
